explains: v. 钦佩，仰慕；欣赏，观赏（admire 的现在分词）

sentences.en: She was used to receiving admiring glances from men.
sentences.cn: 她习惯了男人投来的赞赏目光。

sentences.en: She would form these very neatly out of pieces of twig, and would then decorate them with a flower or two and walk around them, admiring them.
sentences.cn: 她会用小树枝把这些整整齐齐地拼起来，然后用一朵或两朵花装饰一下它们，接着绕着它们转圈，欣赏它们。

sentences.en: His five tall brothers gave him good-by with admiring but slightly patronizing smiles, for Gerald was the baby and the little one of a brawny family.
sentences.cn: 他的五个高个子兄弟向他道了个再见，带着羡慕而略带关注的微笑，因为杰拉尔德在强壮的一家人中是最小和最矮的一个。
